text: BLOOD splatters on white paper. Pull back to see a CHEF w a cut finger standing at the admitting counter, dripping  blood on a form. The uptight Parisian NURSE scolds him an pulls out a new form. ANDY, lugging his back pack, trudges through the sliding  glass doors marked "St. Severin Hospital". Bleary eyed, h over, burdened by a heavy backpack and carrying the crump telegram, he approaches ANOTHER NURSE at the counter.
Um, excuse me... hello...
A STOUT WOMAN with a POODLE charges in front of Andy and  launches into a loud French argument with the nurse over hospital's "human's only" admission policy.
(French) Pitou needs a real doctor! He's  melancholy!
Hey, wait a minute...

Andy tries to push his way back in, but the shrill little dog yaps at him. Andy grabs his aching "hangover head" in agony. The bleeding chef walks away, dripping, leaving th other nurse free. Andy approaches her. She has her head d in some paperwork.
Pardon... Excusez moi. 'Allo.
Without looking up, she holds up a "please wait" finger.  Andy sighs. The poodle yaps at him again. He winces and t to get the nurse's attention.
(to Nurse) Umm...
She raises her finger sharply and glares at him. She goes back to her paperwork. Andy starts chatting politely with her, pretending she's responding.
So, you ever been to Spain? You'd  love it. It's friendly, sunny,  cheap... And you'd be the only raving  bitch there instead of just one in  the crowd up here.
MARCEL BOULARD, a short middle aged cop in a rumpled coat approaches. He taps Andy on the shoulder.
Andrew Mc-dair-mo?
That's McDermott, but yeah.
Marcel flashes his badge.
Detective Boulard. We've been  expecting you. This is Inspector  Leduc.
LEDUC, in his fifties, taller, heavy set, droopy mustache nods gruffly and starts towards the elevator, motioning f them to follow.
He's in charge but, uh, between you  and me, my English is better. (they hurry to catch  up with LeDuc) This way... So you're from New York  eh? I love those Hill Street Blues...
Right. Listen, my uncle, it's not  serious is it? Did he eat some bad  snails? Slip on the bidet? What?
They step into the elevator as LeDuc holds the door open. Marcel and LeDuc trade uneasy glances. LeDuc sighs.
Merde.
He says -
Yeah okay. My French isn't that bad.

TERRENCE lies comatose under a clear plastic oxygen tent. ORDERLY changes the dressing on his bloody stumps. A NURS fiddles with the vast array of bleeping, burbling, suckin life support machinery. Andy, dumb struck, watches from a few paces away. Marcel, pad in hand, asks him questions. LeDuc stays in the  background, listening and studying Andy intently.
Jesus...
How well did, er, do you know him?
Not too well. He taught at the  Sorbonne, right? Dad always calls  him his "hippie brother". Did some  work with Timothy Leary I think, and -  Is he... is he going to die?
No. The doctors say the machines  should keep him going a long time.  But basically he is, how you say, a  legume.
Legume? You mean, a vegetable?
Vegetable, right. My mistake. It  seems he was attacked by a maniac,  maybe two or three maniacs, just  after midnight. yesterday. They fled  into the tunnels beneath Paris, that's  all we know...
What do you mean, maniacs?

Well, here's what I think happened.  A chemistry professor goes to a bad  part of town late at night. Why?  Perhaps he's making a few francs on  the side. The psychedelic drug market  is big these days. He gets mixed up  with a bad crowd and, like they say,  if you lie with dogs, you get fleas.
Yeah, well, these fleas must have  teeth like fuckin' chain saws.

BEEP BEEP! Something's wrong with uncle Terrence's machin The IV bottle is sputtering and bubbling, the EKG monitor flashing. The orderlies snap into action and pull the cur shut, waving "no problem" to Andy and Marcel. Marcel lead Andy away, trying to calm him down.
Maybe we should go now. You must be  very tired. We'll call if any new -
I can't believe this. Why don't you  go down in the tunnels and find the  goddamn... animals that attacked my  uncle?
Andy, it's not so easy. There are  hundreds of kilometers of tunnels  under Paris. It's a whole other city,  crawling with drug addicts, lunatics,  skinheads... It's no man's land.
Andy's about to protest when LeDuc steps in and hands him uncle Terrence's leather bag.
Here.
Your uncle was carrying this. The  keys to his apartment are in there.  I talked to his assistant, Madame  Flocquet. You'll be staying there a  while?
Yeah. I guess so. (they walk him to the  elevator) Did he say anything? Before the coma?
Just the name of this hospital, St.  Severin. He repeated it a few times  then he lost consciousness.
Why would he pick this one?
I don't know. There were others much  closer. He was religious?
Not that I know.
Well, when you're about to pop off,  what have you got to lose? Thanks  for your help.
Andy's dumfounded at Marcel's lack of tact. The elevator  doors start to close. LeDuc nods "good-bye". Marcel leans and sneaks in one last comment.
And remember Andy, let's be careful  out there. Heh-heh... Ouch!
The elevator doors knock him on the head as they close. A shakes his head.
(to himself) Inspector Clouseau, on the case.  Great.

Andy opens the gate of this beautiful 19th century buildi and walks through THE COURTYARD to the main entrance. A P yaps at him. The dog is in the open doorway of the Concie apartment, which opens into the courtyard. The nosy conci MADAME CHRETIEN calls the dog, LULU, back in and shuts th door. Andy enters the dark LOBBY, finds the timed auto shut-off light switch and turns it on. He boards the old fashioned wire cage elevator and presses the button for #4. McDermo The elevator ascends painstakingly slowly. Andy resigns  himself to waiting, thumbs through his uncle's date book. Andy turns to the day Uncle Terrence was attacked. A circ cryptic entry at the bottom of the page reads "Meet Claud Medusa - 11:00". Andy wrinkles his brow. At this second, light goes out. Andy ascends the rest of the way in darkness. The doors o on the fourth floor. He gets out and finds his way to the apartment. He tries a key in the lock. It won't turn. He  jiggles it. No luck. He goes through this with two more k grumbling under his breath. Finally he finds the right on He pushes the door open and gasps. He's face to face with a scary TRIBAL MASK hanging in the entrance way. It startles him for a second.
This must be the place.
Andy walks in and sets down his bags. A gun COCKS. A youn woman's voice screams at him in French.
(in French) Who are you!? What do you want!?
He turns to see SERAFINE, a beautiful young woman, around 22, casually dressed and aiming a pistol at his head. He  drops the shoulder bag and reaches for the ceiling.
Don't shoot! Jesus... uh... Je  m'appelle Andy. McDermott. Je suis  le... um, shit...
It dawns on her. She drops the gun to her side, embarrass
(in English) Oh fuck, you are his nephew...
Yeah, that's the word. And you are?
Serafine Flocquet. I work for your  uncle.
You? You're Madame Flocquet? I  pictured a fat lady with an apron,  not - I don't know - La Femme Nikita.
Serafine puts the gun away in a drawer.
It sounded like someone picking the  lock. After what happened, I guess I  am a little nervous.
She lights a cigarette.
Sure. I can follow that.
It's a fucking nightmare, isn't it?
Yeah. True. The cops weren't much  help either. Their theory is he was  moonlighting as a drug dealer or  something. Make sense to you?
Police. They have their head in their  asshole and they still can't find  shit.
Well put. So, what exactly has uncle  Terrence been up to lately?

As he speaks, he scans the apartment. It's cluttered with overwhelming assortment of anthropological oddities from  around the globe, medieval illustrations, molecular model and an artsy periodic table that's been used as a dart bo
He's doing a book with Professor  Roussel, about medieval chemistry. I  was just transcribing his notes onto  the computer and - oh shit!
She races out of the room. Andy follows after her.
She runs in and finds the computer locked up. She smacks a few times, clicks the mouse, taps the keyboard. No resp
Salots! Shitfucker!
(reacts to her loose  grasp of American  slang) What?
If you leave it for more than a few  minutes it locks up. Now I must reboot  and type a dozen fucking passwords.  He was security crazy.
She flicks a switch on the back of the computer, rebootin it. Andy pauses to look at some nearby photos of his uncl
I still can't get over it. The cops  said it was a "maniac", but he looked  like, I don't know, like he'd gone  through a combine harvester or...  something.
Serafine gets kind of emotional at the thought...
They wouldn't let me see him. Family  only. I told them, Terry was almost  like a father to me, you know?
Andy reacts to her use of the informal "Terry"...
Depends. Was "Terry" a father like  Ward Cleaver or a father like Woody  Allen?
A beat. She grasps his meaning. She's offended. She start typing on the computer, giving him the cold shoulder.
You must not have known him very  well. He's not like that.
Hey, Sorry if I was out of line.
You were. I have work to do. The  publisher wants the transcripts by  Monday. Go. Make yourself at home.
Fine. My mistake. You know, I'm gonna  be a writer myself some day.
Uh-huh. Good for you.
Andy sees he's sunk. He heads for the door, but something the wall catches his eye. A small flyer on the bulletin b with a big drawing of Medusa. He takes it down.
Medusa... What's this? some kind of  club?
It's nothing. A stupid party. Not  really a night club, it's, uh...
Like an underground club?
Yes. It's a bad place. Weird people.  Strange things go on.
And who's Claude?
Serafine looks at him hard, questioning.
I looked through my uncle's date  book. Writer's curiosity.

She points to a paperback on the desk. It's French, with psychedelic cover depicting a man, half King Louis XIV, h witch doctor. The title, (in French) "History Inside Out Psychic Illumination Through the Ages" by Dr. Claude Rous A picture on the back shows an academic looking Claude in tweed jacket, with gray hair.
Professor Claude Rousel. The one  your uncle was working with. He  teaches cultural history.
In an underground club? I'd like to  see that.
He shoves the book in his back pocket. Serafine's emphati
I'm serious. There's nothing for you  down there. It's dangerous.
Come on. I'm from New York - the  "shoot me" state. Don't wait up.
He starts for the door, She spins him around by the sleev
(suddenly quite angry) What good can you do? Why are you  being so fucking stupid?

(getting fired up) Maybe I didn't know him like you  did. But he's my uncle. And I owe it  to him to get some answers. It's a  quest like, uh, Hemingway, the Old  Man and The Sea. Except instead of  an old man I'm a young man, and  instead of the sea, it's a bunch of  tunnels under Paris. And instead of  a big fish it's... who knows? That's  what I'm going to find out. Au revoir.
He walks out of the office. She calls after him.
You're a fucking lunatic!
The front door slams. She looks after him, incredulous.
(French) God damned Americans.
A MEDUSA HEAD is carved in the stone above the doorway of crumbling old facade in a rundown Parisian neighborhood.  Andy tries the front door. It's locked. There's no sounds signs of life.
(to himself) Some party.

In an open cavern, lit with torches and strobe lights. Tw hundred people are gyrating to eerie techno-tribal dance  music. It's a weird crowd, mostly young modern primitive  pierced and grungy RAVERS, many wearing day-glo tribal fa paint. Clusters of sullen, militant SKINHEADS hang around the periphery. An attractive, blissed-out WAIF approaches Andy with a  paintbrush and a jar of day-glo face paint and a brush. S goes to paint Andy's face. He stops her.
That's alright. I'll be a cowboy.
She smiles and pushes his hand down. He shrugs and lets h paint two day-glow red stripes on his cheeks.
Alright. Fine... (with mock enthusiasm) Ooh. I can feel it tingling.
Andy sniffs and makes a face - the paint has a weird smel
Phew. What's in this stuff, liquid  plumber? (he pulls the book  out of his pocket  and shows her Claude's  picture) Do you know this guy? Claude?
Ah oui, le professeur. La bas.

She points to a dark alcove off the main cavern. Andy nod and starts off. We move in on a leather clad young man le against the wall, watching Andy go. This is GASTON DUFAUX self-styled Parisian thug, who seems to be cultivating a  sort of "Mickey Rourke" look. He takes a drag from his  cigarette and we see he's missing two fingers. Andy makes his way through the crowd. People are dancing  with wild abandon, and many carry torches. A SKINNY GUY I DIAPER and a paper mache skull mask runs through the crow ranting and spraying fluorescent silly string. He does a  weird dance around Andy and jabbers at him in French.
Uh, lemme get back to ya on that.
Andy approaches the side room and peers in. A small group young people are listening intently to CLAUDE, whose back to us. He's expounding about something in a solemn tone.
(French, to group) ...How ironic. A man who dedicated  his life to opening the doors of the  mind now lies trapped behind them.  Locked behind a door without a key.
We follow Andy as he steps around the crowd and sees Clau face. He looks older than in the photo - he's in his late fifties, with white hair and intense eyes.
Excusez moi, I...
Claude notices the book in Andy's hand. He speaks fluent  English.
I'm sorry my friend, I'm not signing  books right now. There's been a  tragedy.
I know. I'm Andy McDermott. Terrence's  nephew.
Claude is taken by surprise.
My God, I'm sorry. But how did you  find your way down here? Wait, let's  go talk...
He excuses himself from his "flock" and leads Andy to a q corner of the room. The kids disperse, several looking  sympathetically at Andy.
It's horrible. Terrence was one of  the most brilliant men I've known.
Yeah, well, why did he hang out here?  The cops said it's dangerous -

The cops. It's their backward laws  that force all this underground in  the first place, endangering people  whose only crime is pushing the limits  of perception, exploring new states  of psychic awareness.
They're suddenly doused with day-glo silly string as the  gibbering idiot in the diaper pops in to deliver a rant a them.
(French) The moon is bleeding! Prepare for  the downpour!
He ducks back out. Andy picks the silly string out of his hair.
Psychic awareness. Right.
You think it's silly. But do you  realize that young man is actually  in a deep sleep?
What?
He's on a new drug called ZBH, or  "Daydream". It allows the user to be  fully alert and mobile while he's  dreaming. He is literally conscious  and unconscious at the same time.
Yeah well, that's like really groovy  and everything, but who hacked my  uncle's legs off?
Claude frowns. He looks grave.
Andy...
Yeah?
Terrence and I came down here to do  serious work. For centuries these  tunnels have been home to subcultures  mainstream society would not tolerate.
He gestures to the main cavern, where people are far gone into various states... some in a trance, some gyrating lu to the eerily hypnotic music. We intercut with these imag as Claude speaks.

These people carry on traditions  dating back to pagan times - the  ancient quest for expanded  consciousness. At the same time  they're pioneering a chemical  revolution, powerful state-of-the- art compounds... But you know what I  mean.... (he gestures to Andy's  face paint) A year ago who would have dreamed of  topically applied hallucinogens like  TMD? Except Terry of course...
Andy's eyes widen with comprehension. He touches his face
What!? Hallucinogen? Oh shit...
He rubs the face paint off with his shirt sleeve.
You didn't know? But then why did  you... well, don't worry. It's  relatively mild.
Yeah, well if I claw my face off,  just pack it in ice, okay? Jesus...  the cops were probably right. My  uncle was messed up with a bunch of  fry brains and they went berserk on  him.
Claude lowers his voice. He looks grim.

No... We stumbled on something else  down here Andy. Something horrible,  almost unbelievable. But very real.  It's been going on for centuries,  though most people wouldn't believe  it, or wouldn't want to...
Andy's somewhere between spooked and incredulous. He glan at the book in his hand.
Wait a second, are you like the Steven  King of France or something...
Andy!
Andy turns and sees Serafine run up to him. She looks wor
So you came after all. Just in time,  it's getting interesting.
You must get out of here. It's not  safe.
She grabs him by the arm. He resists.
Not you too -
(checks his watch) My God! Serafine's right. It's time  to go. We'll talk soon.
Bon nuit Claude. (to Andy) Come on.
Claude dashes off. Serafine drags Andy into the main cave
Hey, chill out a second!
She leads him across the cavern towards the entrance. And stops short and pulls away from her. It's not easy - she a strong grip.
Alright, hold on. I'm not gonna get  dragged around like some kid in a  shopping mall. I want you to answer  some questions.
Serafine sees something over Andy's shoulder.
Merde. I knew I shouldn't have come  here.
Andy turns to see Gaston approaching. He leers at Serafin
(French) Serafine, mon cher. I hear your boss  looks great in cut-offs.
(French) Get the fuck away from me, Gaston.
(French) First you tell me where the ADM is,  eh?
He puts his hand on her shoulder. Andy notices the missin fingers.
(French) Fuck you.
She shoves his hand away and pulls Andy past him. Gaston  grabs her and spins her around. This time Andy grabs Gast hand and pulls it off her. He holds up Gaston's three fin hand and glares at him.
Well, this explains the two fingers  they found in Liberace's asshole.
Gaston jerks his hand away. He stabs his finger in Andy's chest.
In Paris we have an expression for  people like you: Enculй d'Americain.
Yeah? In New York we got an expression  too. Goes like this...

CRACK! Andy hauls off and belts Gaston in the jaw as hard he can. But Gaston doesn't even lose his footing. He snee with rage and hits Andy with a vicious combination. His  glasses fly off as he reels into the crowd, knocking a fe people into a group of nearby SKINHEADS. The skinheads er into randomly directed violence - a full fledged BRAWL br out. It's chaos. Serafine!

Someone knocks into Andy and he falls to the ground. He g back on his feet - Serafine's nowhere in sight. He pushes his way through the crowd, looking for her. He catches si of her white dress in a distant corner. It's there for a  second and then gone again - apparently into a tunnel. He runs over to it. Andy peers into THE TUNNEL, which houses some old pipes. fades quickly into darkness. He grabs a kerosene torch fr the wall and runs into the tunnel. About a hundred yards he passes an ALCOVE. He leans in with his torch and peers around. The cave lik room is empty but something catches Andy's eye. The sound of his own breathing  suddenly becomes deafening and his vision begins to disto the textures of the stone wall begin to churn and crawl, the flames from his torch melt into different hues. The  pentagram glows and seems to grow out of the wall... The hallucinatory flash is over as fast as it began. Pant stunned, Andy shakes it off. He wipes his face, checking traces of paint. He tries to reassure himself.
Whoa. C'mon.
A woman's SCREAM echoes through the tunnels. He runs towa it.
Serafine!?

Another scream - anguished, tortured. Andy runs faster. H arrives at an intersection with another tunnel, turns the corner and finds... A decrepit old WINO hogging a bottle from his warty HAG  companion, provoking her to scream like she just lost her only son. They look up at Andy. The hag shuts up. They fi Andy with an odd stare.
Sorry... I, uh, did you see a girl,  la femme, um, avec, la dress blanc?

They just stare at him. Spooked, he walks past them. They follow him with their creepy stare as he continues into t tunnel, which slopes downhill. He comes to an old stairway leading down into darkness. W pours out of a hole in the ceiling. The steps are severel eroded and slick with flowing water and moss. Andy sees  something. Ahh! Son of a bitch!

He shoots down the stairs on his back, past the shoe whic lies at the mouth of an intersecting tunnel. His glasses  come off. The torch goes out. He stops at the bottom of t stairs on a gravel surface. He winces a bit as he sits up. It's too dark to make much out. He feels around the gravel, finds his GLASSES - they shattered. He scowls. He stands up and walks ahead, feeli his way along the slick wall, peering into the darkness.
SERAFINE!?

barrels around the corner, flooding the tunnel with light and closing on Andy fast.
Oh shit!

As he looks back at the SPARKING, RU TRAIN WHEELS, his heart pounding in his head, he has anot HALLUCINATORY-FLASH: the sparks explode into streaking  patterns of color and light. It passes quickly. Another HOWL. Andy swallows har

He hurries along. HELP! OFFICER!

FOR GOD'S SAKES, LET ME OUT!!

It bit me! My leg! Jesus, it's down  there, shoot it! Shoot it for Christ's  sakes!

LeDuc ignores him, continuing to open drawers. The techni appears to have found the right one at the far end.
Inspector! C'est le voici.
A little exasperated, LeDuc and Andy go over to see what technician has found. Once again, LeDuc gives him the nod He opens the drawer to reveal
It's badly lacerated. Parts of her throat and midriff are missing, and she has only one eye. Andy gasps in horror.
We know you were with her.
Oh shit... No...
That's not all... (he reaches for another  drawer above Amy's) Marcel - Officer Boulard was following  you.
Oh no... no....
He pulls open the drawer to reveal MARCEL'S MANGLED CORPS There's a gaping hole in his midsection.
He was a good man. Now his wife is a  widow.
(overcome) This is... it's like a sick joke, I -
LeDuc grabs Andy by the collar and slams him against the  wall
This is not a joke! Not a dream!  These people are dead and -
TAP TAP... Through the small window in the door he sees C PICARD, his superior, trying to get his attention.
Merde... Wait here. When I return  you tell me about last night, huh?
But... I don't remember anything, I  swear...
(sternly) I leave these open. Maybe something  comes back to you.

He leaves the room. The technician leaves too. Andy's alo staring at the corpses. Through the window, he can see Le arguing loudly with his superior... Andy tries to breath  deeply, calm down. He turns back to look at Amy's corpse. Suddenly, her eyes - well, her eye - snaps open and looks straight at him!
Thanks for the lovely evening,  shithead!
Aaaaa! Jesus! This isn't happening.  I'm still hallucinating. Shit!
Andy storms around in a fit of disbelief.
You really know how to show a girl a  good time, don't you?
LeDuc and the Chief have stopped their argument briefly t watch Andy stomping around, gesturing wildly. They resume their argument.
(French) Okay. So he's weird. Maybe on drugs.  Still, that's not -
I'm telling you. It's not drugs.  It's something more. Someth -

Don't give me your black magic  bullshit! Seven mutilations in forty  eight hours and all you find is a  scrawny American boy? Do you have a  motive? (LeDuc hesitates) Do you have a weapon? Or do you want  me to believe he did it with his own  two hands?
(exasperated) I told you. These murders are not  normal.
The Chief rolls his eyes, "here we go again" style. Meanw
Andy is still pacing the room madly.
Face it boyfriend. This is really  happening.
No it isn't! You're dead!
Marcel comes to life and peeks over the top of his drawer
I'm afraid she's not so lucky. She's  undead. And so am I.
Aaaaa!!! Get the fuck away from me!
What are you so damn angry about?  Did somebody turn into a wild beast  and rip your intestines out? Huh?
I spent four years on StairMaster  for this bod and you rip through it  like a pork chop. Thanks.
Andy blinks hard. Every time he opens his eyes, Marcel an Amy are still there, hideous as ever, staring at him.
Okay... dead or undead... what do  you want from me?
A-duh... You're a werewolf. And we,  as your victims, have to walk the  earth until your curse is lifted.
Uh huh... And, supposing I believed  that, what could I do about it?
(together) Kill yourself.
It's the only way.
It's not so hard. I used to think  about it all the time. Maybe you  should meet my wife.
Andy buries his head in his hands.
Enough. Cut him loose.
I can't! At midnight tonight, he  will kill again. It's crazy!
Are you crazy? We have nothing. Let  him go, then watch him. If you're  right, you can pick him up at  midnight. Or maybe he'll lead you to  the others. Just let him go.
The chief leaves. LeDuc scowls. He looks in at Andy, stil gesticulating wildly and talking to thin air. LeDuc reent the room and looks at Andy bitterly.
You're free to go.
Andy looks from LeDuc to the drawers and back again.
Me?
LeDuc gives him an angry stare.
Andy walks past Notre Dame, flanked by Marcel and Amy.
Hanging is nice. Never goes out of  style. What about hare-kare - a taste  of the Orient? But no! You're in  Paris! Try the Guillotine! There's  one in the Louvre!
I'd use pills. They're painless.
Oh give me a break! He could use  pills back in America! Why not get a  little culture?
Andy stops in his tracks - overwhelmed, desperate.
Look, I didn't mean to hurt anybody...  God, I didn't mean to... to...
Rip my face off? Hey, we all make  mistakes. Hell, I didn't mean to  sleep with you on the first night,  especially without a condom. But I  did, and now I'm paying the price.
Andy slumps over, beaten. Amy puts her arm around him. Ma pats him on the back. They start him walking along.
Let's face it. It's a, how do you  say... mother-fucker. But we're all  in it together. That's why we're  trying to help you.
Exactly.

HOOOOONNNNK!! Andy looks up to see a speeding bus about t flatten him. Amy and Marcel have lead him into traffic. H jumps back and the bus just grazes him. Of course, it pas right through Amy and Marcel. They're still standing ther when it's gone.
Merde! Just missed!
(to Andy) Uhh! Would you die already!
Andy's adrenaline is pumping. There's still some fight in him.
Fuck you! If I'm gonna kill myself  I'll do it when I'm good and ready!  You can go to hell!
No we can't. That's the problem. God  knows it would beat hanging around  with you!

Andy socks Marcel and breaks his jaw - off. It skitters o into the street. He punches him in the gut - SKLURCH! His fist gets stuck in the tangle of Marcel's abdominal organ While Andy tries to pull his hand free, Amy rears back an kicks him in the balls. He wrenches his hand loose and  staggers back, clutching his groin.
Hey, you can't kick me! You're an  apparition!
What, all of a sudden you got a degree  in supernatural law?
Marcel fits his jaw back into place.
Call it the power of suggestion.
He socks Andy in the mouth. Andy shakes it off, rips Marc arm off, bashes him in the face with it, then turns aroun and uses it to beat Amy over the head. Meanwhile...

head_text.subj: IN AN UNMARKED POLICE CAR PARKED A HALF BLOCK AWAY

text: RENE and FRANCOIS, the two cops who accompanied LeDuc to  Andy's apartment, watch Andy whirl around the sidewalk,  swinging wildly at the air, reacting to invisible blows, cursing unseen enemies.
(French) You know, in his own way, he's  probably happier than any of us.

Francois nods philosophically. Meanwhile, back in Andy's  reality... Marcel has got him in a full Nelson and Amy is punching h in the stomach. He bucks forward, wrenching both of Marce arms off and slams them together onto Amy's head, knockin her down. Andy waves Marcel's arms in triumph.
Ha-ha!

Oh, big man. You can beat up a couple  of cadavers. Well let me make  something real clear, asshole. If  you don't kill yourself, at midnight  tonight you're gonna transform and  murder innocent people!
What are you going to be, McDermott?  A coward and a murderer? Or a man,  with guts enough to do the right  thing?
The truth of this question hits home with Andy. A heavy  expression falls over his face, one of grave sadness, but also inner dignity. He breathes deeply and exhales.
Alright. Let me write a letter.
Good man. Now can I have my arms  back?

Music cue: Thelonius Monk's "Round Midnight". The NEWS ST MAN hands Andy some stamps. Andy sticks them on a letter  addressed to Mr. and Mrs. William McDermott. He starts wa away but a postcard in the display rack catches his eye - it's Rodin's " The Kiss". He looks at it sadly.
Andy drops the letter in the box. He walks to a pay phone the sidewalk. Amy and Marcel lean on a nearby building,  watching Andy dial. Terrence's answering machine picks up
(French) Hey. This is Terrence. Please leave  a message at the beep... (English) In other words, this is Terrence  McDermott. Please leave a message. (it BEEPS)

Hey, Serafine, I hope you're checking  these. It's Andy. So I guess you  knew what was wrong with me yesterday.  Unfortunately it took me until today  to realize it, and because of that  two people are dead. If you didn't  know, well, shit, it's irrelevant  now. I know what I have to do, but  before I do it I just wanted to say...  I don't know what would've happened  with us, but I'm really glad I had  the chance to know you even if it  was only a couple of days and... I  don't know... I probably wouldn't  have the nerve to say this if I was  gonna see you again, but I think if  I had the chance to kiss you one  more time I would've fallen totally  in love with you.
The door opens, Serafine enters and runs to the machine.
Oh well... Bye Serafine.
Serafine snatches the phone off the receiver just as Andy hangs up. She gets a dial tone. She's very upset.
Merde!
Amy and Marcel watch Andy hang up in the phone booth. The emotion of the moment is getting to Amy.
Geez, I feel bad for him. Maybe we  should've told him abou -
Are you crazy!? You know that's  totally impractical. Besides, like  the Bible says... (he sticks his finger  in her empty eye  socket) An eye for an eye...
Amy nods. Andy exits the phone booth and approaches them. "Round Midnight" fades out.
Let's do it.
Andy drains the last of a bottle of Jack Daniel's and wob along, totally smashed and a bit wistful, with Amy and Ma in tow.
What the hell, lots of my heroes  killed themselves. Hemingway, Van  Gogh... um... Herve Villachaise...
But this is class kid, all the way.  What a way to go.
You got style, babe. That's why I  went for you in the first place.
They're approaching the Eiffel tower.
When they ask how I died, just tell  'em... Ei-ffel.
sit in their car, watching Andy buy his ticket and get in the elevator.
(French) Should we follow him up?
Well, he's gotta come down some time.  Fuck it, let's grab a bite.
Good thinking.
It's a typical Parisian bakery, stuffed to the ceiling wi an unbelievable array of the finest, most delectable past Rene steps to the counter.
Vous avez les doughnuts?
We're looking at the elevator doors. They open. Andy stri out onto the deck, through the milling TOURISTS, flanked Marcel and Amy.
There's only one thing certain in  life - each of us owes God a death.

Proud, determined, Andy arrives at the six foot wire mesh fence and quickly scales it. Amy and Marcel follow. Nearb tourists are alarmed and a clamor of concern rises up. Th with camcorders jockey for position.
All we can do is make sure it's a  good one.
Andy gets over the fence and stands on the small ledge. A and Marcel join him. The tourists gasp. Andy glances down THE PRECIPITOUS DROP. He turns suddenly pale.
Shit. I feel sick.
Don't worry. In a few seconds you  won't feel a thing.
Puking on yourself in midair is not  a good death.
Look, the more you think about it,  the harder it is.
Just like sex with my wife.
The key is don't look down.
Also like sex with my wife.
(to Marcel) Would you shut up?
Andy looks woozy. Tourists are trying to dissuade him in  Italian, Japanese, Icelandic, etc. Marcel tries a new tac
Tell you what, we'll jump together.
(picking up Marcel's  lead) Sure. We wouldn't ask you to do  anything we wouldn't do. Now give me  your hand... that's it...
Amy coaxes Andy's hand off the fence. The crowd gasps. An grits his teeth and focuses again.
One... two... three... JUMP!
They jump, but Andy stops short - GASTON is leaning over fence and has Andy by his shirt.
You're not getting off so easy.
Plummet through the air. They look back at Andy, annoyed.
Merde! I can't believe this!
You try to be a good sport, and look  what happens.
SPLAT!! Their bodies split into several pieces and squirt out on the pavement into two radial patterns, each about feet in diameter. Repair will take a while this time.
Huh. Galileo was right.
Who?
has Andy by the arm and is trying to pull up to "safety". The tourists cheer him on. Andy is resisting.
Where's the ADM? Where did your uncle  put it?
Man, I don't know what the fuck you're  talking about.
Bullshit! Your uncle told you!
My uncle's in a coma you moron!
Before the coma!
He didn't tell me anything. All he  said was Saint Severin...
Andy swallows the word "Severin", remembering something a he speaks. Suddenly wheels are turning in his head.
Saint Severin? The church? So you  know all about the ADM! (Andy reacts to the  word "church?") Where is it! Tell me! Tell me or  else!
Or else what? You'll kill me?
No. But I'll kill your fucking  girlfriend!
You'll never get the chance.

Andy pulls backward as hard as he can, jerking Gaston off balance. He's trying to pull them both to their deaths, b Gaston grabs a STEEL POST with his free hand. Andy hangs below the ledge, pulling Gaston's arm down wit all his new superhuman strength. But Gaston pulls back ju as hard. Andy sees The STEEL POST start to bend. He looks into Gaston's FERAL STARE and understands...
It was you! You son-of-a-bitch! You  got my uncle!
The POST keeps bending - its welds won't hold long.
Don't be an idiot! I'm not the only  one. If I die, Serafine dies!
Bullshit! You're bluffing!
What, you think Claude hangs out  underground cause he likes to dance?
This gives Andy pause.
Claude...?
And you call me a moron...

Andy stops pulling. He looks uncertain - maybe Gaston is  right... But then - SNAP! The post, which has bent all th way over into a "J" shape, snaps its weld. Gaston and And plummet towards the ground nine hundred feet below. The  tourists gasp. Using the bent pole as a hook, Gaston snares a HORIZONTAL ANTENNA which sticks out of the tower about fifty feet un the observation deck. He stops short and dangles there, s gripping Andy by the arm. The tourists CHEER. Meanwhile,  nine hundred feet below...
lean on their car, munching doughnuts. The tower looms be them, and we can just make out the dangling figures at th top. Rene reaches into the paper doughnut bag and comes u short.
(French) Oh! You ate the last jelly!
Gaston's grip is firm. They'll have to climb up the iron  cross beams to the observation deck.
The ADM. Let's go.
Yeah, okay. Just gimme a minute to  freshen up.
Andy and Gaston climb up onto the deck. The tourists appl and cheer for Gaston - the "hero".
Bravo! Magnifique! Wunderbah!
Gaston can't resist posing as the cameras flash - he suck in his cheeks, purses his lips and does his best "Mickey  Rourke". Andy looks at him, incredulous.
I must be in Paris. Even the  werewolves are poseurs.
Gaston and Andy endure the elevator ride together.
So, if you and the nutty professor  are both werewolves, what do you  want with drugs? You like seeing  lots of pretty colors when you're  tearing people's throats out?
If you know about the church, why  ask such stupid questions?
They step out of the elevator and up to the apartment doo Andy takes his key ring out and tries the lock. The key w turn. Andy jiggles it.
Damn...
He tries another key. It doesn't work. He jiggles it, rat the door on its hinges.
What's the problem?
Hey, I'm new here, what do you want?
Andy tries a third key. No good. More jiggling.
Fucking cretin...
The fourth key works. Andy pushes the door open. Gaston s him in roughly and steps in after him.
Gaston shuts the door behind him and walks over to Andy, scans the room nervously, unsure of his next move.
Where is it? Hurry up!
Andy's eyes come to rest on the end table drawer, where  Serafine had put the gun before... He advances toward it.
(patronizing) Okay, okay. I got your magic medicine  right here, dogboy. Just -
Gaston grabs Andy's hand before he opens the drawer.
Do you think I'm an idiot?
(beat... incredulous) Sure. Don't you?
He shoves Andy away and opens the drawer... no gun. They  hear a pistol COCK behind them.
Looking for this?

Gaston turns and sees Serafine aiming the gun at him. Wit incredible speed he leaps for the window as Serafine fire BANG!! The bullet catches him in the arm as he dives thro the glass. BANG!! She fires again and misses. Gaston lands in the courtyard, three stories below, and r off with a slight limp. BANG! BANG! Serafine fires blindl into the courtyard after him, overwrought with anger. And puts a hand to her arm, and she lowers the gun. They embr tightly, desperately. Serafine can't keep from crying. An comforts her.
Hey, hey... shhh. It's okay now...  La Femme Nikita strikes again.
He wipes away her tears and she smiles at his joke.
Andy, I thought... I heard your  message and... thank God you're  alright.
She embraces him again, but Andy gently frees himself.
I'm not alright. We both know that.  The only reason I'm here now is to  warn you. You're still in danger.  Gaston told me that Claude has got  the curse too. He's a werewolf.
I know. He told me.
What?! He told you? When?
Andy hears a familiar voice behind him.
Two weeks ago.
Andy spins around to see Claude standing by the hallway t Terrence's office. Andy reaches for the gun and points it him.
You two faced bastard. I knew you  were full of shit.
Andy! No!
She puts herself between Claude and the gun barrel. Andy  pushes her out of the way.
Serafine! Move! Don't you see, he's  just after the drug, that ADM stuff.  He's using you to get to it, just  like he used Uncle Terrence.
Claude approaches Andy, speaking calmly.
You're exactly right, Andy. I enlisted  both Serafine and your uncle to obtain  ADM. And now I'm counting on your  assistance too.
Why the fuck would I do that?
Because, Andy. It's a cure.
A cure?
A cure. With ADM we can wipe out  lycanthropy, the curse of the  werewolf, forever.
Andy is shocked, stunned, skeptical. He bluffs with the o card he's got.
Is that so? Maybe we should go to  Saint Severin church and make sure,  huh?
Claude's face changes. He's surprised.
Ah, you've done your homework...  Excellent. Get your coat. Leave the  gun with Serafine. She can keep  searching. We don't have much time.
Andy and Serafine share a heavy look. He hands her the gu
Andy... I should never have let you  go underground. I'm sorry...
(shaking his head) I had to be a damn Hemingway hero.  Well I'll tell ya, the old man and  the sea didn't go through half this  shit.
Sheets of rain crash down over this ancient gothic church Sharing an umbrella, Andy and Claude walk inside.
Parked across the street, Rene and Francois watch them en the church. Rene talks into a cellular phone.
(French) He's going into Saint Severin church  with Professor Claude Roussel.
(on phone) Really... Okay, keep checking in.
LeDuc hangs up and thinks a moment. He turns the page of old book on his desk, revealing an old woodcut illustrati of a policeman being attacked by a werewolf. He frowns.

An evening mass is in progress. The boy's choir fills the church with a solemn hymn. Andy follows Claude to a narro staircase. An OLD WOMAN gives them the evil eye and cross herself as they pass. Claude and Andy go up the stairs an arrive at a balcony under a magnificent wall of ancient  STAINED GLASS. One of the panels catches Andy's eye.
Whoa...

THE PANEL shows a weird medieval ritual - a man draining  blood from another man's neck into a goblet. ANOTHER PANE features a pentagram. ANOTHER PANEL shows a huge werewolf eating a monk under a frowning sun. All the transcription are in Latin. Claude signals Andy to follow him.
The panels that concern us are over  here. (he directs Andy to a  group of panels) I'll translate the Latin.
A PANEL shows a different werewolf, tied down, being stab in the heart by a knight under a frowning moon.
"Then Simon did slay the demon spirit,  the same as had made him unclean,"
THE NEXT PANEL - the knight now holds the beast's heart a impaled on his dagger. Where the beast was, a man lies  bleeding in the background.
"and Simon did cut out the heart of  the beast which once dead, regained  the shape of a man"
THE NEXT PANEL shows the beast's heart on a platter. The  Hero is sitting at a table, cutting into the heart with a knife, as if he's about to eat it.

"Simon ate of the heart of the beast  and his soul was cleansed." (he turns to Andy) These pictures are not just myth,  Andy. The scholars of the day used  them to record facts and enlighten  the public. This is the medieval  version of a newspaper.
(skeptical) Yeah, well what if it's the Weekly  World News...
No. It's all true, Andy...
Startled, Andy turns to see Amy and Marcel, a little wors for wear, standing behind them.
I mean, if by some miracle you can  find the werewolf that bit you, and  then manage to eat it's heart, the  curse is lifted. I was gonna tell  you but Marcel wouldn't let me.
Oh sure, it was all mean old Marcel's  idea. Give me a break! We didn't  tell you because it's a wild goose  chase! Not to mention disgusting.  Look...
Marcel reaches into his own chest cavity, rips out his ow slimy purple heart, and thrusts it in Andy's face.
A little Grey Poupon and then Bon  appetite, eh?
Andy grimaces and turns back to Claude.
(to Amy) I don't believe we've been introduced.
What?... Oh, right, you can see these  guys too. Jesus... (he rolls his eyes)
(smiles and extends  her hand) Amy. Nice to meet you.
Claude shakes her hand - SQUISH. Some sort of body fluid  oozes out of Amy's hand. Claude frowns and discreetly wip his hand with a handkerchief. Marcel smiles and extends h hand.
Marcel. (Claude smiles  politely, declining  Marcel's rotting  hand) My wife has all your books.
Claude nods "thank you". Andy's had enough.

Great. Later on we'll have to get  together for cocktails. Right now I  kinda have to hurry before I grow a  lot of hair and eat people. (to Claude) Say this heart thing works. What's  it got to do with ADM?

It's chemistry, Andy. Nothing more.  Mutated antigens concentrated in the  heart of the infector unlock a vaccine- like chain reaction in the infectee.  There were not many bio-chemists  working in the twelfth century, but  with today's technology it's possible  to synthesize any chemical imaginable.  When I discovered this ancient cure  I knew who to go to.
Uncle Terrence.

Yes. I was able to decode the old  texts and give Terrence the  specifications. It took a lot of  trial and error, but finally he got  it: Adenine Di-Methyloxide. ADM. I  call it ADAM. But just before he was  attacked, he hid it...
Because Gaston was after it.
Yes, that sociopath. He's given  himself over to the evil of  lycanthropy. To him, ADAM is just a  threat to the terror he holds over  others. To us, it's salvation.
Yeah, well I don't know much about  chemistry, but even if this stuff  works, you better find it by midnight.  Otherwise it's -
Yeah, I know. Back to the Eiffel  Tower. (to Claude) And what about you?
Believe me, I won't go through another  night of that hell. I have my  contingency plan right here.
He removes a WHITE PILL from his coat pocket and holds it up.
Sodium cyanide.
The CHURCH BELLS ring. The group listens tensely as the s bells sound eight times.
Eight o'clock. Shit. You'd think my  uncle would have left a clue, a note,  something...
That's what Serafine is searching  for. Without much luck, I'm afraid.  If only we could speak with him. But  alas, he's off in another realm,  close to death.
The wheels in Andy's head are turning. He looks over at A and Marcel. He smiles. He's got an idea.
Andy, please. Don't smile like that.  You're scaring me.
Andy and Serafine walk down the corridor of the Terminal  Ward. Andy looks determined. Serafine looks upset.
What makes you so sure this will  work?
I told you. He already tried to  contact me once. If you saw his  face... He was desperate to tell me  something. I owe him this.
I don't know...
Listen, either he wastes away as a  pathetic vegetable or he can give  what's left of his life to save  hundreds of potential victims. He's  a McDermott. I know what his choice  would be.
I suppose you're right. But I still  don't like it.
They stop at the door to Terrence's room.
Fine. You don't have to watch. Stay  out here and stand guard.
She nods. Andy goes into

The lights are off. Andy approaches Terrence's oxygen ten In the dim light, he can barely make out Terrence through the plastic, lying motionless, barely making an impressio under the sheets. He looks at the body wistfully and surv the array of machinery that's keeping him "alive". Most o the machines are plugged into a TRANSFORMER BOX on the fl
Hey. We meet again... Look, I know  you understand what I'm about to do  here. I think. But I hope you forgive  me anyway.

Andy takes a deep breath. He leans down to the transforme and opens the safety cover, and flips the power switch. A the machines power down. Suddenly the old man in the bed sits up, gasping, and cla at the walls of the oxygen tent. Oh my God! It's NOT  Terrence!! Andy nearly soils himself, diving down to fumb with the transformer, suddenly all thumbs. He switches th power on again.

The fat, sour looking duty nurse sees the alarm from the  failed life support system. She's about to call for help  when the indicator stops flashing. She watches it intentl for a few seconds, nothing. She decides to dismiss it.

The old man is lying back down, asleep. He seems to be ok His support machinery is functioning normally again. With a sigh of relief, Andy turns and pulls back the curt behind him. There's Terrence, sans oxygen tent, hooked up another extensive support system.
So. You moved...
He pulls the curtain closed behind him, and moves in clos to his uncle. Terrence's expression looks unmistakably mo
You don't look happy... Um, I don't  usually go in for this stuff, but... (He crosses himself,  and says a silent  prayer) Amen.

Andy leans down, opens the transformer box, and flips the power switch. The machines power down - all except the EK monitor, which shows a flat line and emits the familiar s tone. Andy switches off the monitor. Silence. Terrence's body is completely still, peaceful. He leans d over its face and speaks in a soft voice.
Uncle Terrence? Can you hear me?
Terrence's body remains motionless.
This time the nurse doesn't wait to respond. Seeing the  indicators from Terrence's room, she presses the intercom
Chambre 411. Code bleu! Code bleu!
Silence. Andy's worried. He takes his uncle by the should
Come on... Skip the undead orientation  and get down here.
Nothing. He looks at the door nervously.
Serafine sees a squad of doctors and nurses pushing troll of emergency equipment her way from the far end of the ha She leans her head in the door to warn Andy.
Andy is beside himself with stress. He shakes Terrence's a little to rouse him. Nothing. He tries a little harder  shake... The door opens. It's Serafine, also in a panic.
They're coming!
Shit. What have I done? (to Serafine) Stall them! I'll meet you out back.
She shuts the door, just in time. The emergency team are  right there.
(feigning hysterics) Stay away from him! You butchers!  Haven't you done enough already!
They struggle to get past her.
Andy can hear Serafine arguing outside the door. He looks out the window to the three story drop into the alley bel
Serafine is finally shoved aside. They push the door open

Andy rushes to the door and pushes it shut. He cranks the DOORKNOB all the over and bends it down, jamming it in th locked position. He steps away. The door holds, but for h long? He looks at the old man in the oxygen tent. Hmm. He pushes the old man's bed up against the door. Andy forces the window open and steps out onto the ledge. looks back at his uncle, and the old guy. He shrugs  apologetically, then takes a deep breath, closes his eyes and jumps.

The fat nurse is getting impatient with the doctors, who attempting to pick the lock "surgically". She pushes them aside and heaves her considerable heft against into the d It opens a crack. She backs up and slams it again...
The nurse's jolts shake the old guy's bed, sliding it for He dozes happily like a baby rocking in the cradle.

location: THE BACK ALLEY BEHIND THE HOSPITAL

text: Andy runs behind a nearby dumpster to avoid being seen fr the window above. He kicks the wall in frustration.
Damn it!!
A voice calls out from behind Andy.
Whoa! What an outrageous nightmare!
Andy spins around and sees Terrence, the undead version,  perched atop some trash bags, scratching himself.
Uncle Terrence?
Andy? Andy is that you?
Yeah. Look, uncle Terrence -
